author: thefriendsociety

text:
@thefriendsociety 

The movie reminds me of the 80s movie The Burbs.  On drugs.  A depressed talking tentacle who wants to start his own rock band, a radioactive meteor who by game's end gets his own talk show, the galaxy police, a microwavable hamster, a mummified uncle who spends his time in the shower, etc.  There is so much random stuff in this game that no matter what the quality of the film was, it would have definitely attracted a loyal, die hard fan base.

author: thewhistler

text: This game is amazing and this is probably my favorite video game song next to the "Athletic" Theme from Yoshi's Island. My name also happens to be Dave which makes this extra cool haha. But yeah the game was amazing, it had multiple endings, and story arcs depending upon who you picked. Me and my friend sat down and beat it one day, with Dave & Michael (the photographer). Michael developed some film or something which led the plot in a totally different direction. Awesome,awesome game.

author: Justin Jones

text:
Maniac Mansion could have been an absolute classic if it was adapted for the big screen.  I mean, the game's plot was basically one giant reference toward's the beloved B-movies of the 80's.  

A mysterious meteor sets off a mad doctor to kidnap the high school "it" as he tries to steal her brain and set off armageddon.  Her boyfriend and his two best friends set off to rescue her from evil.  

Jesus.  Think about it.  This film would have been the cult classic to end all cult classics.
